channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5651] Spring fails to initialize if switchyard application includes cxf.xml and server has no internet access
item.description:
A switchyard application which includes a cxf.xml file (eg. to define a soap interceptor) runs properly if the machine is able to connect to the internet. If that's not the case, the deployment fails with the WARN message shown below, and the interceptor is no longer called.

16:55:37,768 INFO  [org.apache.cxf.bus.spring.ControlledValidationXmlBeanDefinitionReader] (MSC service thread 1-4) Loading XML bean definitions from class path resource [cxf.xml]

	at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.DefaultDocumentLoader.loadDocument(DefaultDocumentLoader.java:76) [spring-beans-4.1.6.RELEASE.jar:4.1.6.RELEASE]
 
	at org.apache.cxf.bus.spring.TunedDocumentLoader.loadDocument(TunedDocumentLoader.java:116) [cxf-rt-core-2.7.18.redhat-1.jar:2.7.18.redhat-1]
 
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadDocument(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:429) [spring-beans-4.1.6.RELEASE.jar:4.1.6.RELEASE]
 
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:391) [spring-beans-4.1.6.RELEASE.jar:4.1.6.RELEASE]
 
	... 42 more
item.summary: Spring fails to initialize if switchyard application includes cxf.xml and server has no internet access

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Martin Weiler I think what we're seeing here is something like this :

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8100965/cannot-find-the-declaration-of-element-beans-in-internet-offline-mode

I've tried a bunch of the approaches (classpath:, relative path, etc) to try to get to spring-beans.xsd, also tried adding spring-beans.xsd to the soap-proxy jar without much success.

I can get the tests inside soap-proxy to run pretty easily without internet if I change the schemaLocation in cxf.xml to something like this and then copy the file to soap-proxy and soap-proxy/src/main/resources :

http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans spring-beans-2.5.xsd

However, when I'm deploying to EAP, I'm still getting the error, I think because I haven't found the right place to put the xsd file. Maybe I need to add a META-INF/spring.schemas file to the soap-proxy JAR? I'm not sure.

The fix here seems to be that we need to import the org.springframework.beans module. I tried to do this a number of ways, but this seems to work offline :

Edit soap-proxy/src/main/resources/META-INF/jboss-deployment-structure.xml
Add :

            <module name="org.springframework.beans" export="true">
 
                <imports>
 
               <include path="META-INF"/>
 
                </imports>
 
            </module>

I tested this on EAP 6.4.5 + R2 and 6.4.8 + Fuse 6.3 131, and it works on both.

Hi Tom,

Can we please validate the suggested fix?
I've just tried it on FSW 6.0 + RU (the customer's environment) as well as Fuse 6.2.1 (EAP 6.4.8). Here's my Fuse 6.2.1 procedure:

  • Edit /bin/standalone.conf to include this line:
    JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Dcxf.config.file.url=file:///PATH/TO/CUSTOMERFILE/01632333/cxf.xml" // Any cxf.xml will do
  • Toggle the network off. (Validate with a ping to www.google.com or something)
  • Start the Fuse 6.2.1 server
  • Build quickstart 'camel-soap-proxy'
  • Deploy reverse-service/target/switchyard-camel-soap-proxy-reverse-service-2.0.1.redhat-621084.war
    • Validate that the server is unhappy about the cxf.xml:
      Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionStoreException: Line 10 in XML document from URL file:/home/rick/support/01632333/cxf.xml is invalid; nested exception is org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 10; columnNumber: 75; cvc-elt.1: Cannot find the declaration of element 'beans'.

The above shows the problem. To try the suggested remedy:

  • shut down the server, remove the deployed .war, remove the logs
  • add jboss-deployment-structure.xml to reverse-service/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF.
  • build reverse-service, deploy as done above.
  • The same error results.

So...... is the fix still considered valid? Did I miss something?

Thanks,

Rick
Please see latest comment, trying to validate suggested fix. (It seems to be failing.)
I think the issue here is that the jboss-deployment-structure.xml needs to be in soap-proxy/src/main/resources/META-INF. The changes above work for me when using the reproducer app.

Hi Susan,
No, not yet. It's on the to-do pile, but I haven't reached it yet. It's not forgotten!
Thanks,
Rick
I just tried this again against 6.4.9, and it works fine for me. I'm going to move it to resolved, we can always reopen it again if necessary.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• Use the modified camel-soap-proxy quickstart attached to this JIRA. It contains a cxf.xml file and a custom soap interceptor in the soap-proxy project
  • Build and run the quickstart as per the instructions from the Readme file
  • If the machine has internet access, the custom interceptor will be registered during deployment:

16:54:11,137 INFO  [org.apache.cxf.bus.spring.ControlledValidationXmlBeanDefinitionReader] (MSC service thread 1-2) Loading XML bean definitions from class path resource [cxf.xml]
 
16:54:12,337 INFO  [stdout] (MSC service thread 1-2) [MyUsernameTokenOutInterceptor] initialized

and the interceptor will be called as expected:

16:54:49,821 INFO  [stdout] (http-/127.0.0.1:8080-1) [MyUsernameTokenOutInterceptor] handleMessage...

  • Disable the internet access on the machine where the server is running, and re-test. This will result in the WARN message during deployment, and no interceptor will be called during invocation.
